issues.description: The solution repository changed the no-argument Person() constructor to package-private (default) while the template (and the client code) expect and use a public constructor (new Person()). Because client classes (PersonScene, controllers) are in different packages than de.tum.in.ase.eist.model, the package-private constructor prevents instantiation from the client code and therefore contradicts the template and the intended usage. This is a structural visibility mismatch that would cause compilation errors or confusion when comparing/using the solution code.
issues.suggested_fix: Restore a public no-argument constructor for Person (change 'Person() {}' to 'public Person() {}') in the solution's common model so it matches the template and allows client code in other packages to instantiate Person. Alternatively, move client classes into the same package as Person (not recommended) or provide a public factory method — but making the constructor public is the simplest fix and preserves the educational intent.
